content: Generally error messages contain a reason or reason code. Not just failed. Are you sure that is all there is the the error dialog?

content: No error message. After clicking to send, it takes a very long time for the failed pop up.
creator: illroute66

content: Server works if I login to Yahoo Mail as I'm able to do that. Issue with Thunderbird login. Any ideas?
creator: illroute66

content:
illroute66 said
Could be this? https://downdetector.com/status/yahoo-mail/

It could be.

illroute66 said
Server works if I login to Yahoo Mail as I'm able to do that. Issue with Thunderbird login. Any ideas?

sing web mail uses none of the yahoo IMAP or SMTP servers, so you are not compering apples with apples.

However if the delay is measured in minutes it may be a timeout is happening where the server is simply not responding, or you have software (antivirus usually) that is blocking the connection and seeing abnormal activity. Firs up a cold restart of your computer and any modems or routers is a good idea.
creator: MattAuSupport

content: Is the something of an issue here, or are you just wanting everyone to know you have never had a problem. Rather unusual if that is the case.
creator: MattAuSupport

content: are you using the mailkey instead of your password as required by ATT?
creator: MattAuSupport

content: Are you using authentication method of oauth in Thunderbird to connect to yahoo? (check account settings > server settings) You probably need to be.
creator: MattAuSupport

content: Hi Matt, thanks for responding -- It was set to "normal password" but it's been working fine up til just now (which seems weird?). I just changed it to oauth2, and Hallelujah! - it seems to have fixed it. THANK YOU!!  :D
creator: clistforseattle
